docs.snippet: Media, telecom and other industries struggled to find lawmakers who would be critical of big technology companies. Not anymore.

headline.print_headline: Rivals Seize Their Chance To Redo Rules
headline.main: Big Tech’s Rivals Pounce at Chances to Win in Washington

docs.snippet: There’s no panacea for the harm that propaganda, trolls and false news sites do to democracy, but education and public vigilance are essential.

headline.main: Stop the Manipulation of Democracy Online

docs.snippet: As social media companies wield greater power in the political system, more safeguards are needed.
A series of scandals have opened up the possibility that the company may have created something it can’t fully control.

headline.print_headline: Facebook’s Frankenstein Moment: A Creature That Defies Technology’s Safeguards

docs.snippet: The government fears that political activism online hurts the state, but regulating internet content will hurt it even more.

headline.print_headline: Vietnam wants to control social media? Too late.
headline.main: Vietnam Wants to Control Social Media? Too Late.

docs.snippet: Oops! Facebook admits it created a democracy-crushing Frankenstein monster that it can’t control.
Platforms like Facebook and Twitter offer up memes designed to feel real, if only for an instant — long enough for our minds to make a false connection.

headline.print_headline: How Fiction Becomes Fact on Social Media
headline.main: How Fiction Becomes Fact on Social Media

docs.snippet: Apple, Google, Microsoft and other giants are accelerating their efforts to remake health care with new tracking apps, sensors and other tools.

headline.print_headline: This Health Revolution  May Be All in the Wrist
headline.main: How Big Tech Is Going After Your Health Care

docs.snippet: Our guests on Facebook Live discussed concerns Muslim Americans have in the aftermath of a terrorist attack in New York this week.

headline.print_headline: Discussing Bias Against Muslims After a Terrorist Attack: ‘The Media Does Play a Role’
headline.main: Discussing Bias Against Muslims After a Terrorist Attack: ‘The Media Does Play a Role’

docs.snippet: An anti-Islamic image created by a Kremlin-connected group has proved hard to kill, an indication of the challenge of monitoring social media for propaganda.

headline.main: For Russian ‘Trolls,’ Instagram’s Pictures Can Spread Wider Than Words
